RECORD.TEXT: 0542403 913472 9/15/1998 12:00:00 AM WOLFE-PARKINSON WHITE SYNDROME . Unsigned Report Status : Unsigned Please do not go above this box important format codes are contained . DISCHARGE SUMMARY AZI01HL DISCHARGE SUMMARY TLANDSEUSS , CHERE C 083-97-79 ADMISSION DATE : 09/15/1998 DISCHARGE DATE : The patient is a 72 year old white male who was transferred from Cay Memorial Hospital Of for cardiac catheterization and Electrophysiology Studies . hypercholesterolemia , hypertension and insulin dependent diabetes mellitus . He has a history of chest pain and in January 1993 underwent a cardiac catheterization at Ph University Of Medical Center which revealed an occluded right coronary artery with distal filling via left to right collaterals , a large left anterior descending with a 40-50% proximal stenosis and a co-dominant left circumflex with mild disease . An echocardiogram showed an ejection fraction of approximately 50% and mild to moderate mitral regurgitation . He was again found to be in a wide complex tachycardia and was treated with magnesium . He denied any associated chest pain or dyspnea and he ruled out for a myocardial infarction . He continued to have intermittent runs of the wide complex tachycardia and was therefore transferred to Ph University Of Medical Center for further evaluation and management . Prior to transfer he did have one episode of chest pain during the night without electrocardiogram changes . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : Atenolol 25 mg bid . Prilosec 20 mg qd . Resulin 400 mg qd . Lisinopril 10 mg bid . Aspirin . Lasix 60 mg qd . PHYSICAL EXAM : He was comfortable with a blood pressure of 156/78 , pulse 56 and respirations of 16 . His lungs were clear throughout . His apical impulse was nondisplaced with a regular rate and rhythm , normal S1 and S2 but not S3 or S4 . Carotid pulses were 2+ bilaterally and there was no jugular venous distention . LABORATORY DATA : BUN 18 , creatinine 1.8 , magnesium 1.5 , cholesterol 154 with an HDL 41 , LDL 100 . His creatinine phosphokinase was 42 . His hematocrit was 49.3 . His electrocardiogram showed sinus bradycardia with a delta wave and an intraventricular conduction delay consistent with Wolf Parkinson White Syndrome . There were also nonspecific ST-T wave abnormalities . The patient clearly was suffering from atrial arrhythmias conducting down his bypass tract which were difficult to manage and causing symptomatic palpitations . Given his known coronary artery disease and his recent heart failure and chest pain a cardiac catheterization was indicated prior to proceeding to an electrophysiology study . His initial cardiac catheterization had to be postponed given the possibility of an allergy to Prednisone . Accordingly the patient underwent uneventful cardiac catheterization on 9/17/98 which revealed a pulmonary capillary wedge pressure of 25 and a left ventricular end diastolic pressure of 20 . He had a 50% proximal left anterior descending stenosis and only minor disease to the left circumflex . The patient then underwent an electrophysiology study on 9/20/98 . There was no inducible supraventricular tachycardia but he did have evidence of a left lateral bypass tract . Radiofrequency ablation was applied there and resulted in the elimination of the preoperatively-excitation . He still did have occasional short runs of atrial tachycardia but there were no associated palpitations . His Sotalol was therefore decreased to 120 mg bid and his QT and QTC intervals decreased to .45-.48 seconds . After the procedure he was started on Heparin and loaded on Coumadin for a period of the next 3-4 weeks following radiofrequency ablation . His INR was 2.3 prior to discharge and he was scheduled to follow-up with the Anticoagulation Clinic to follow his Coumadin dose . Finally , his dementia appeared to worsen following receiving medications for agitation during his EP study . Finally , his blood pressure had trended up during his hospitalization particularly with the decreased dose of Sotalol . He was discharged in stable condition on 9/23/98 . FOLLOW-UP : He will follow-up with Dr. Taarnna Service at Ph University Of Medical Center as well as Dr. Lupevickette Folk and Dr. Dwainco Rallsversgach on Villean Garl . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : Atenolol 25 mg bid . Lasix 60 mg qd . Ecotrin 1 qd ( on hold until off of Coumadin ) . Coumadin 5 mg qhs or as directed for four weeks . Prilosec 20 mg qd . Aricept 10 mg qhs . NPH insulin 8 units q am , 5 units q pm . CZI insulin two units q am . Resulin 400 mg qd . Electronically Signed AO RIELNAKA FOLK , M.D. 09/24/1998 11:47 DD : LUPEVICKETTE FOLK , M.D. CAY MEMORIAL HOSPITAL OF TINDRIENE ACROOKESJO CAY MEMORIAL HOSPITAL OF STAT
